adjective.description: Of, relating to, or designating small extinct reptiles of the thecodont suborder Pseudosuchia, which includes primitive, often bipedal, carnivores that were probably ancestral to dinosaurs, pterosaurs, and crocodiles, and are known from remains found mainly in Triassic deposits.

origin: Early 20th century; earliest use found in Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London. From scientific Latin Pseudosuchia, suborder name + -an.
